description: From Late Latin protasis, from Ancient Greek πρότασις (prótasis), from προτείνω (proteínō, “put forward, tender, propose”), from πρό (pró) + τείνω (teínō, “stretch”).

entries.meaning: The first part of a play, in which the setting and characters are introduced
(logic, grammar) A clause that expresses a contingent element in a conditional sentence
examples: In "I will be coming if this weather holds up", "if this weather holds up" is the protasis, and "I will be coming" is the apodosis.
